So, basically, what I would do as a first step (but don't take only my word for it; I hope others post) is something like this:
And, don't be shy about using the Problems and Symptoms and Responses to heap on the conflict and drama.
Got it. Disregard that last question.

Get a bunch of paper, or word documents, enough to make five outlines.
One for each throughline (MC, IC, SS, and OS) and one that is the outline you already have.
Then, take the first signpost for each throughline, and explore it. So, if one is The Past, jot down a bunch of things that are relevant about The Past in that particular throughline. Make sure there's enough conflict in there to push the characters around, so they aren't static. (Like, "The MC's old gun jams and he's got to talk his way out of the alley where they brought him to die.") 
See if somewhere in your ruminations you end up making a trajectory to your second set of signposts. (This will be similar to getting from "refusal of the call" to "meeting the mentor" or any sort of getting from one stepping stone to another.)
simulpost.

Open your Story Engine. Bottom Left corner is your MC's Problem, Solution, Symptom and Response.

The story engine settings report if I am being frugal with paper.  The story points report if I am not.

The other place to see all your story points easily are the Story Points window (tile on desktop), and the Story Engine Settings report (listed as the first of the Advanced Reports in the Report window popup menu).
